00029 #ifndef SC_UTILS_IDS_H
00030 #define SC_UTILS_IDS_H
00031 
00032 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00033 //  Report ids (utils)
00034 //
00035 //  Report ids in the range of 800-899.
00036 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00037 
00038 #ifndef SC_DEFINE_MESSAGE
00039 #define SC_DEFINE_MESSAGE(id,unused1,unused2) \
00040     namespace sc_core { extern SC_API const char id[]; }
00041 namespace sc_core {
00042     extern SC_API const char SC_ID_REGISTER_ID_FAILED_[]; // in sc_report_handler.cpp
00043 }
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 SC_DEFINE_MESSAGE(SC_ID_STRING_TOO_LONG_,
00047                   801, "string is too long")
00048 SC_DEFINE_MESSAGE(SC_ID_FRONT_ON_EMPTY_LIST_,
00049                   802, "attempt to take front() on an empty list")
00050 SC_DEFINE_MESSAGE(SC_ID_BACK_ON_EMPTY_LIST_,
00051                   803, "attempt to take back() on an empty list")
00052 SC_DEFINE_MESSAGE(SC_ID_IEEE_1666_DEPRECATION_,
00053                   804, "/IEEE_Std_1666/deprecated" )
00054 SC_DEFINE_MESSAGE(SC_ID_VECTOR_INIT_CALLED_TWICE_,
00055                   805, "sc_vector::init has already been called" )
00056 // available message number 806
00057 SC_DEFINE_MESSAGE(SC_ID_VECTOR_BIND_EMPTY_,
00058                   807, "sc_vector::bind called with empty range" )
00059 SC_DEFINE_MESSAGE(SC_ID_VECTOR_NONOBJECT_ELEMENTS_,
00060                   808, "sc_vector::get_elements called for element type "
00061                        "not derived from sc_object" )
00062
